wikipedia_page.main:
George Carney (21 November 1887 – 9 December 1947) was a British stage and film actor.
He worked in the Liverpool Cotton Exchange, in a furniture business, then in the Belfast shipyards. He then took up concert work and entered vaudeville before eventually turning to film.

Windfall is a 1935 British drama film adapted by Jack Celestin and Randall Faye from the R. C. Sherriff play of the same title. The film was directed by Frederick Hayward and George King, and starred Edward Rigby and Marie Ault and George Carney. When an elderly ironworker receives a financial windfall, he uses the money to retire, but his family and those around him behave irresponsibly.

Paid in Error is a 1938 British comedy film directed by Maclean Rogers and featuring George Carney, Lillian Christine and Tom Helmore. The screenplay concerns a man who is mistakenly given a large sum of money at the bank.

Father Steps Out is a 1937 British comedy film directed by Maclean Rogers and starring George Carney, Dinah Sheridan, Bruce Seton and Peter Gawthorne. Wealthy cheese manufacturer Joe Hardcastle (George Carney) falls prey to a gang of con men, but is rescued in the nick of time by his chauffeur (Bruce Seton).
Easy Riches is a 1938 British comedy film directed by Maclean Rogers and starring George Carney, Gus McNaughton, Marjorie Taylor and Tom Helmore.

Hyde Park is a 1934 British comedy film directed by Randall Faye and starring George Carney, Barry Clifton and Eve Lister.BFI.org It follows a socialist who refuses to give permission for his daughter to marry an aristocrat, but changes his mind when he himself comes into money.
